document.masterDocTitle: The ultor - group of the genus Dolichogenidea Viereck (Hymenoptera, Braconidae, Microgastrinae) from China with the descriptions of thirty-nine new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The ultor - group of the genus Dolichogenidea Viereck (Hymenoptera, Braconidae, Microgastrinae) from China with the descriptions of thirty-nine new species

Distribution. Eastern Palaearctic [ China Beijing , Henan ]; Oriental [ China ( Guangdong , Guangxi , Guizhou , Hunan , Sichuan , Yunnan , Zhejiang ), India , Malaysia , Sri Lanka , Vietnam .

Remarks. Features of these specimens agree with the original description of Nixon (1967) and type species. Compared the species
D. acutituba Chen, Song & Yang
described in 2006, we found that they are the same species for possessing the following diagnostic characters: the well-defined areolation and costulae on propodeum, the shapes, proportions and appearances of T1, T2 and T3, the length and shape of ovipositor and the colour of hind femur and pterostigma.
